companyName: Alliance Computer Systems Ltd. Taiwan Branch
title: Frontend Web Engineer
details: Designed and developed reusable components which can be utilized on different web-based slot games
Managed states in ReactJs by using Redux to simplify programming logic

title: Full Stack Developer
details: At frontend, I developed the user operating platform, which included functions such as the login system, horse race ticket trading system, and user center; I also designed the back office system, which supported game operators in controlling the details of horse racing games. All content at front-end was implemented using javascript, jQuery, html5, and CSS, and we used Spring Web MVC to implement the backend system. Besides the main business of horse race system, I also led a side project which is a client site of shopping platform for iOS implemented by Xamarin. This app included user registration system, shopping cart system and purchase authentication.

title: Software Engineer
details: We had to develop an integrated platform that included member systems and social functions; the third-party game developer was then allowed to put their product on the platform without concerning the clients. I participated in developing the user authentication function, which controlled the login process of valid members and supported designing the player matching system. This solved the issue of how to distribute players evenly.

title: Teaching Assistant
details: As I wanted to share my ideas and findings with others, I became a teaching assistant in both Digital Circuit Experiment and Computer Organization Experiment. In Digital Circuit Experiment, I taught the basics of logic gates and how to implement advanced logic circuits on breadboards. In Computer Organization Experiment, I taught students how to implement a fundamental CPU by using Verilog on an FPGA board. My teaching experience also gave me the opportunity to cultivate my knowledge and presentational skills.

title: Intern
details: Based on my experience leading a 3D game project, I helped game programmers discover memory leak issues when loading new 3D views. It was here that I gained first-hand experience in developing product-level systems in a collaborative environment.
